response.message: I posted a link to this page on all the metas for the sites having elections (except for MSO as it was already there). So far I've had positive feedback from all sites apart from Server Fault where there were a couple of comments stating that the page didn't work for them.

The YQL load always fails for me in 4 different browsers -- something about the YQL site is rejecting my IP or address.

I can still view the cached election pages which is more than good enough for my purposes!

“Democracy is a highly imperfect process, but it is a participatory imperfect process.” Well said! I think the moderator elections are one of the most outstanding features of the Stack Exchange sites: where else does the community have this level of control? SE is on one level with Wikipedia.

Looking forward to the elections on the other community sites.

I've updated that page to remove the YQL dependency. If you still experience problems, please post a comment here: http://meta.stackoverflow.com/q/75726 or look for me in the chatroom: http://chat.meta.stackoverflow.com/rooms/89/the-tavern-general
